name: Professor: Big bunch of tools v1
description: As a name indicates a very big toolbox. With 57 cards in deck it has a more feeling more like you are playing MTG ;)

name: Reina Roja's Draining Machine
description: Aggressive, R&D lock-based credit denial deck based on ICE derezzing and destruction. The focus on R&D allows a total capitalization of the Kraken nuke, otherwise too situational. Deep Red allows for fast support for your Darwin with Bishops, and Pawns placed on the opponent's HQ allow for free Rook-ES combos that can make sure that you get to the point, and that you do quickly. Crescentus to derez HQ's ICE should force the corp to give his ultra-expensive , Rooked R&D ICE full priority and let you do the trick quite often, without having to face real HQ threat; that is, especially if you consider that you're supposed not to play any Account Siphons. Comments welcome, as usual!

name: The Acelerated World
description: draw very fast thx to Jackson Howard, Anonymous Tip and Green Level Clearance for fast advance and finish game with combo: Shipement samsam about Project Beale or Executive Retreat

name: Toulouse 2013
description: Anarch fixed breaker suite with Crypsis and datasucker/desperado . Awesome breaking suite . Many event to use during the first phase of the game. The key card is of course account siphon and same old thing to abuse ... then larla to restart ...

name: Dorans Blades Accelerated. vHJ1.5
description: Sea Source=Power Shutdown Rework=Accelerated Diagnostics. After rereading Crimson Wraiths opinion on Private Contracts I took out 3 GLC for 3 PC. Play testing tonight. I've only played Dorans blades twice before and bothe times I lost. I'll see of this build works better overall with its lower card and money requirements for the combo. :) Thanks again to Crimson Wraith for the original deck concept.

name: Riena Lives Dangerously
description: this deck makes the corp broke and runs cheap. Looking for feedback.

name: GRNDL over advance
description:
Overadvance ghost branches (after you have scorched in hand), project atlas to taste, and grndl refineries. That's a win win lose proposition for you. Two options make you rich, 1 option tags the crap out of the runner. The runner only wins if he runs an overadvanced atlas, and that comes with a bite if you have 1,2, or even 3 PC's in hand.

Do it once with atlas scoring a few counters, and they're likely to run it the second time, put in an atlas or ghost branch. Let them take the atlas, and instantly tudor up 2-3 punitive counterstrikes with atlas counters and do meat damage to them. They also let you go get scorches if you install a ghost branch that they run and hit. It creates the ultimate bluff by over advancing deck!

nb4 simone...wasted click and deck space. Operation econ is more than enough to not worry about advancement money. You can always do like hedge fund, adv, adv. Next turn 3 adv. Then beanstalk 2 adv.

Matrix analyzer might be the correct play here over tollbooth. -2 tollbooth +2 matrix analyzer? -1 sea source -2 toll booth + 3 matrix analyzer??

name: Forcing Eureka! to work
description:
Lots of large items to use eureka with, you can even use same old thing to help cheat even more items into play. Yes thats 1 full turn to use SOT + eureaka, so...decide if putting a torch into play is worth a turn. This is definitely a bad johnny deck, but should help inspire the purpose of this deck. Hey, at least once its up and running its okay.

Don't feel like you need to use all 10 of the card's power, drawing and installing a card costing 5 but paying 3 is still a discount so don't feel too bad.

name: Kate's Programming suite
description: Host all the things that aren't breakers on Djinn, host 2 breakers on omnidrives and 1 on dino, whichever is faction appropriate. Scavenge helps set that up, and recur crescentuses. This is a cheap runs, shaper-setupy deck. Might be fun to goof around with, but not competitive.

name: Whizzard's Chess (experimental)
description: cred denial and cheap runs. looking forward to trying it.

name: Hivemind 3.0b
description: This deck was designed to generate lots of credits, lots of MU, lots of Link, and some damage mitigation. The extra click from The Collective comes in handy for a variety of situations.
